unit_learning_outcomes.description: Explain the biological effects of radiation
Summarise the working principles of x-ray tubes and how these influence their operation and performance
Critically appraise the principles of radiographic image production and processing
Identify the properties of x-rays and explain how they interact with matter, and influence image quality and patient safety
Contrast the generation and use of advanced imaging modalities
Summarise radiation protection in relation to radiography

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Revision of lecture, tutorial and laboratory work

enrolment_rules.description: 130cp at 1000 level or above including 40cp at 2000 level

assessments.description: An online quiz on material covered in lectures and tutorial sessions on module 2 - image formation
The exam will assess material from the whole semester

assessments.assessment_title: Data analysis and interpretation of X-ray interactions
assessments.description: An assignment to explore data analysis and interpretation of X-ray interactions
An online quiz on material covered in lecture and tutorial sessions on module 1 - physics

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: HLTH3140 - Radiographic Physics, Practice and Protection
data.description:
This unit is conducted to develop students' knowledge in the underlying physical principles of medical radiation science. The unit is presented in three distinct modules:
- Module 1 is the study of Radiation Physics, its principles and current technology of imaging equipment.
- Module 2 is the study of the principles and practice of image production and image processing techniques.
- Module 3 describes the biological effects of radiation as well as current radiation protection techniques.
data.search_title: HLTH3140 - Radiographic Physics, Practice and Protection
